Elvish Archdruid.name: Elvish Archdruid
Elvish Archdruid.flavor: He knows the name of every elf born in the last four centuries. More importantly, they all know his.
Elvish Archdruid.text:
Other Elf creatures you control get +1/+1.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool for each Elf you control.

Elvish Visionary.name: Elvish Visionary
Elvish Visionary.flavor: Before any major undertaking, a Cylian elf seeks the guidance of a visionary to learn the will of the gargantuan ancients.
Elvish Visionary.text: When Elvish Visionary enters the battlefield, draw a card.

Elvish Handservant.name: Elvish Handservant
Elvish Handservant.flavor: The hardest lesson for any elf to learn is humility. It takes a giant to teach that.
Elvish Handservant.text: Whenever a player casts a Giant spell, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Elvish Handservant.

Elvish Branchbender.name: Elvish Branchbender
Elvish Branchbender.flavor: "How do the vinebred feel? Fah We do not ask the puppet how it feels when the puppeteer bids it dance."
Elvish Branchbender.text: {T}: Until end of turn, target Forest becomes an X/X Treefolk creature in addition to its other types, where X is the number of Elves you control.

Elvish Hexhunter.name: Elvish Hexhunter
Elvish Hexhunter.flavor: "All manner of curses, blights, and luckspoils infect Shadowmoor. We stalk them, one perilous quest at a time."
Elvish Hexhunter.text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Hexhunter: Destroy target enchantment.

Elvish Eulogist.name: Elvish Eulogist
Elvish Eulogist.flavor: "No matter how adept our artistic skill, our effigies can never hope to capture the vibrant beauty of a living elf. Perhaps that is truly why we mourn."
Elvish Eulogist.text: Sacrifice Elvish Eulogist: You gain 1 life for each Elf card in your graveyard.

Elvish Promenade.name: Elvish Promenade
Elvish Promenade.flavor: The faultless and immaculate castes form the lower tiers of elvish society, with the exquisite caste above them. At the pinnacle is the perfect, a consummate blend of aristocrat and predator.
Elvish Promenade.text: Put a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token onto the battlefield for each Elf you control.

Elvish Harbinger.name: Elvish Harbinger
Elvish Harbinger.text:
When Elvish Harbinger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an Elf card, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

Elvish Skysweeper.name: Elvish Skysweeper
Elvish Skysweeper.flavor: The spires of Ravnica are no different from the tall trees of other planes. The elves navigate and protect them just the same.
Elvish Skysweeper.text: {4}{G}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target creature with flying.

Elvish House Party.name: Elvish House Party
Elvish House Party.flavor: The party was going strong for nearly an hour past midnight—then all of a sudden it just petered out.
Elvish House Party.text: Elvish House Party's power and toughness are each equal to the current hour, using the twelve-hour system.

Elvish Aberration.name: Elvish Aberration
Elvish Aberration.text:
{T}: Add {G}{G}{G} to your mana pool.
Forestcycling {2}({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Forest card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

Elvish Soultiller.name: Elvish Soultiller
Elvish Soultiller.flavor: Mutated elves wondered if this was their final form, or if it was just another step.
Elvish Soultiller.text: When Elvish Soultiller is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, choose a creature type. Shuffle all creature cards of that type from your graveyard into your library.

Elvish Pathcutter.name: Elvish Pathcutter
Elvish Pathcutter.flavor: In harsh times, the strongest currency is cooperation.
Elvish Pathcutter.text: {2}{G}: Target Elf creature gains forestwalk until end of turn.

Elvish Guidance.name: Elvish Guidance
Elvish Guidance.flavor: "Old home never forgotten, new home ours forever."
Elvish Guidance.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G} to his or her mana pool for each Elf on the battlefield (in addition to the mana the land produces).

Elvish Lookout.name: Elvish Lookout
Elvish Lookout.flavor: Like a masterful quilter, Yavimaya stitches together patches of color to warn its denizens of threats.
Elvish Lookout.text: Shroud (This permanent can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

Elvish Scrapper.name: Elvish Scrapper
Elvish Scrapper.flavor: "The stories tell of a distant time when machines overran the forests, destroying everything that lived. That time will not come again."
Elvish Scrapper.text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Scrapper: Destroy target artifact.

Elvish Piper.name: Elvish Piper
Elvish Piper.flavor: From Gaea grew the world, and the world was silent. From Gaea grew the world's elves, and the world was silent no more. —Elvish teaching
Elvish Piper.text: {G}, {T}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.

Elvish Pioneer.name: Elvish Pioneer
Elvish Pioneer.flavor: "Destruction is the work of an afternoon. Creation is the work of a lifetime." —Kamahl, druid acolyte
Elvish Pioneer.text: When Elvish Pioneer enters the battlefield, you may put a basic land card from your hand onto the battlefield tapped.

Elvish Champion.name: Elvish Champion
Elvish Champion.flavor: "For what are leaves but countless blades  To fight a countless foe on high."  —Elvish hymn
Elvish Champion.text: Other Elf creatures get +1/+1 and have forestwalk. (They're unblockable as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

Elvish Impersonators.name: Elvish Impersonators
Elvish Impersonators.text: When you play Elvish Impersonators, roll two six-sided dice one after the other. Elvish Impersonators comes into play with power equal to the first die roll and toughness equal to the second.

Elvish Berserker.name: Elvish Berserker
Elvish Berserker.flavor: Their fury scatters enemies like a pile of dry leaves.
Elvish Berserker.text: Whenever Elvish Berserker becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.

Elvish Herder.name: Elvish Herder
Elvish Herder.flavor: Before Urza and Mishra came to Argoth, the herders prevented their creatures from stampeding. During the war, they encouraged it.
Elvish Herder.text: {G}: Target creature gains trample until end of turn.

Elvish Vanguard.name: Elvish Vanguard
Elvish Vanguard.flavor: "Our lives are woven together like the trees' branches over our heads, forming a canopy that protects us all."
Elvish Vanguard.text: Whenever another Elf enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on Elvish Vanguard.

Staff of the Flame Magus.name: Staff of the Flame Magus
Staff of the Flame Magus.flavor: A symbol of passion in indifferent times.
Staff of the Flame Magus.text: Whenever you cast a red spell or a Mountain enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.

Staff of the Mind Magus.name: Staff of the Mind Magus
Staff of the Mind Magus.flavor: A symbol of sagacity in bewildering times.
Staff of the Mind Magus.text: Whenever you cast a blue spell or an Island enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.

Staff of Domination.name: Staff of Domination
Staff of Domination.text:
{1}: Untap Staff of Domination.
{2}, {T}: You gain 1 life.
{3}, {T}: Untap target creature.
{4}, {T}: Tap target creature.
{5}, {T}: Draw a card.

Hollow Warrior.name: Hollow Warrior
Hollow Warrior.flavor: Though it moves like a living thing, anyone can tell it lacks a soul—not to mention mercy.
Hollow Warrior.text: Hollow Warrior can't attack or block unless you tap an untapped creature you control not declared as an attacking or blocking creature this turn.

Elvish Warrior.name: Elvish Warrior
Elvish Warrior.flavor: "My tales of war are the stories most asked for around the fires at night, but they're the ones I care least to tell."

Warrior's Stand.name: Warrior's Stand
Warrior's Stand.text:
Cast Warrior's Stand only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.

Sandstone Warrior.name: Sandstone Warrior
Sandstone Warrior.flavor: "I used to describe something stable as ‘rock solid.' So much for that expression." —Gerrard of the Weatherlight
Sandstone Warrior.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
{R}: Sandstone Warrior gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

Black Lotus.name: Black Lotus
Black Lotus.text: {T}, Sacrifice Black Lotus: Add three mana of any one color to your mana pool.

Lost Soul.name: Lost Soul
Lost Soul.flavor: Her hand gently beckons, she whispers your name—but those who go with her are never the same.

Soul Net.name: Soul Net
Soul Net.text: Whenever a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

Blue Elemental Blast.name: Blue Elemental Blast
Blue Elemental Blast.text: Choose one - Counter target red spell; or destroy target red permanent.

Divine Intervention.name: Divine Intervention
Divine Intervention.text:
Divine Intervention enters the battlefield with two intervention counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove an intervention counter from Divine Intervention.
When you remove the last intervention counter from Divine Intervention, the game is a draw.

Divine Retribution.name: Divine Retribution
Divine Retribution.flavor: "To the undiscerning eye, justice and vengeance can look the same." —Rashida Scalebane
Divine Retribution.text: Divine Retribution deals damage to target attacking creature equal to the number of attacking creatures.

Spiraling Embers.name: Spiraling Embers
Spiraling Embers.flavor: The akki knew to stay indoors on the days the oni flew their kites.
Spiraling Embers.text: Spiraling Embers deals damage to target creature or player equal to the number of cards in your hand.

Ember Shot.name: Ember Shot
Ember Shot.flavor: Dwarves bring poor coal to market, use good coal in their homes, and throw their best coal away.
Ember Shot.text:
Ember Shot deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

Draw a card.

Emberwilde Djinn.name: Emberwilde Djinn
Emberwilde Djinn.flavor: A hefty price is no guarantee of quality merchandise.
Emberwilde Djinn.text:
Flying

At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may pay {R}{R} or 2 life. If he or she does, the player gains control of Emberwilde Djinn.

Ember Beast.name: Ember Beast
Ember Beast.flavor: Spot one ember beast, attack. Spot a second, best fall back. —Dwarven saying
Ember Beast.text: Ember Beast can't attack or block alone.

elvish mystic.name: Elvish Mystic
elvish mystic.flavor:
"Life grows everywhere. My kin merely find those places where it grows strongest."
—Nissa Revane

Elvish Spirit Guide.name: Elvish Spirit Guide
Elvish Spirit Guide.flavor:
"We are never without guidance, if we but seek it."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter
Elvish Spirit Guide.text: Exile Elvish Spirit Guide from your hand: Add {G} to your mana pool.

Elvish Ranger.name: Elvish Ranger
Elvish Ranger.flavor:
"No one may fault an Elvish Ranger's heart, but the simplest frailty may fell even the proudest warrior."
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

Elvish Bard.name: Elvish Bard
Elvish Bard.text: All creatures able to block Elvish Bard do so.

Elvish Healer.name: Elvish Healer
Elvish Healer.flavor:
"The Kjeldorans keep the Orcs at bay and we train their healers. Most human bargains aren't as fair."
—Laina of the Elvish Council
Elvish Healer.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn. If that creature is green, prevent the next 2 damage instead.

Cursed Land.name: Cursed Land
Cursed Land.text:
Enchant land
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted land's controller, Cursed Land deals 1 damage to that player.

Obsianus Golem.name: Obsianus Golem
Obsianus Golem.flavor:
"The foot stone is connected to the ankle stone, the ankle stone is connected to the leg stone..."
—Song of the Artificer

Wall of Bone.name: Wall of Bone
Wall of Bone.flavor: The Wall of Bone is said to be an aspect of the Great Wall in Hel, where the bones of all sinners wait for Ragnarok, when Hela will call them forth for the final battle.
Wall of Bone.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{B}: Regenerate Wall of Bone. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

Throne of Bone.name: Throne of Bone
Throne of Bone.text: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

Bog Wraith.name: Bog Wraith
Bog Wraith.flavor:
'Twas in the bogs of Cannelbrae
My mate did meet an early grave
'Twas nothing left for us to save
In the peat-filled bogs of Cannelbrae.
Bog Wraith.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

Llanowar Elves.name: Llanowar Elves
Llanowar Elves.flavor:
One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing

Elvish Lyrist.name: Elvish Lyrist
Elvish Lyrist.flavor: To an elf, magic and music are the same.
Elvish Lyrist.text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Lyrist: Destroy target enchantment.

Elvish Scout.name: Elvish Scout
Elvish Scout.flavor: Even one whose ears were closely tuned to the sounds of Havenwood could miss hearing a Scout move past.
Elvish Scout.text: {G}, {T}: Untap target attacking creature you control. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by it this turn.

Garruk, Primal Hunter.name: Garruk, Primal Hunter
Garruk, Primal Hunter.text:
+1: Put a 3/3 green Beast creature token onto the battlefield.
−3: Draw cards equal to the greatest power among creatures you control.
−6: Put a 6/6 green Wurm creature token onto the battlefield for each land you control.

Elvish Fury.name: Elvish Fury
Elvish Fury.text:
Buyback {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

Xanthic Statue.name: Xanthic Statue
Xanthic Statue.flavor:
"Until you have lived as a statue, do not talk to me of pigeons."
—Karn, silver golem
Xanthic Statue.text: {5}: Until end of turn, Xanthic Statue becomes an 8/8 Golem artifact creature with trample.

Sengir Vampire.name: Sengir Vampire
Sengir Vampire.text:
Flying
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.

Copper Tablet.name: Copper Tablet
Copper Tablet.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Copper Tablet deals 1 damage to that player.

Black Vise.name: Black Vise
Black Vise.text:
As Black Vise enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
At the beginning of the chosen player's upkeep, Black Vise deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of cards in his or her hand minus 4.

Celestial Prism.name: Celestial Prism
Celestial Prism.text: {2}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

Elvish Mystic.name: Elvish Mystic
Elvish Mystic.flavor:
"Life grows everywhere. My kin merely find those places where it grows strongest."
—Nissa Revane

Basalt Monolith.name: Basalt Monolith
Basalt Monolith.text:
Basalt Monolith doesn't untap during your untap step.
{T}: Add {3} to your mana pool.
{3}: Untap Basalt Monolith.

Ankh of Mishra.name: Ankh of Mishra
Ankh of Mishra.text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield, Ankh of Mishra deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

Elvish Hunter.name: Elvish Hunter
Elvish Hunter.flavor:
"Elves often tipped their arrows with a drug that caused a deep but harmless sleep."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. III
Elvish Hunter.text: {1}{G}, {T}: Target creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

Elvish Farmer.name: Elvish Farmer
Elvish Farmer.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Elvish Farmer.
Remove three spore counters from Elvish Farmer: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.
Sacrifice a Saproling: You gain 2 life.

Elvish Archers.name: Elvish Archers
Elvish Archers.flavor: I tell you, there was so many arrows flying about you couldn't hardly see the sun. So I says to young Angus, "Well, at least now we're fighting in the shade!"

Demonic Attorney.name: Demonic Attorney
Demonic Attorney.text:
Remove Demonic Attorney from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.
Each player antes the top card of his or her library.
